summary: Yoki Finance is a Web3 subscription payment gateway that aims to revolutionize the subscription economy by providing a decentralized, censorship-resistant, and non-custodial solution. The project is open-source and operates under the GNU General Public License v2.0, contributing to the growth of the OSS ecosystem by allowing developers to build their own subscription-based products using its contracts. The grant will be used to fund further development and launch a self-service platform for merchants.
review: Yoki Finance presents a compelling case for funding as it aligns well with the round's focus on enhancing Web3 accessibility and usability. The project offers a novel utility by addressing the limitations of current Web2 subscription gateways, such as censorship and fund freezing, with a decentralized alternative. The application highlights its open-source nature, which is crucial for contributing to the OSS ecosystem. However, the application lacks detailed evidence of measurable outcomes and a clear sustainability model, which are critical according to the model specification. The project is independent and has not received VC funding, which could be seen as a strength in terms of maintaining autonomy and focus on community-driven goals. Overall, while the project shows promise, it requires more detailed planning and evidence of impact to fully meet the constitutional principles outlined in the model specification.

strengths.title: Open-Source Contribution
strengths.description: Yoki Finance operates under the GNU General Public License v2.0, allowing developers to build their own subscription-based products, thus contributing to the growth of the OSS ecosystem.

strengths.title: Decentralized and Censorship-Resistant
strengths.description: The project offers a permissionless, censorship-resistant, and non-custodial solution, addressing the limitations of Web2 subscription gateways.

strengths.title: Alignment with Web3 Goals
strengths.description: Yoki Finance aligns with the round's focus on enhancing Web3 accessibility and usability by providing a decentralized subscription payment gateway.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide clear, measurable outcomes or quantifiable results, which are essential for data-driven decision-making.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Sustainability Model
weaknesses.description: The project lacks a detailed sustainability model, raising concerns about its long-term viability without continuous funding.

changes.title: Provide Measurable Outcomes
changes.description: Include specific, quantifiable outcomes and metrics to demonstrate the project's impact and success.

changes.title: Develop a Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Outline a clear sustainability model that reduces dependency on continuous donations and ensures long-term viability.
